intro: Eragrostis huillensis, commonly known as the Huillén grass, is a perennial grass species native to South America, particularly found in regions of Argentina and Chile. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in dry grasslands and along riverbanks. The plant has narrow, wiry leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences that contain numerous tiny grains. It is adapted to withstand drought conditions and has a deep root system for water absorption. Botanically, it belongs to the Poaceae family and is valued for its ecological role in stabilizing soil in degraded areas.
